title: The Street
creator_contributor_role: National Film Board of Canada, producer

Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Death
Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Grief - Psychological aspects
abstract: In soft simple washes of watercolour and ink, Caroline Leaf evokes a child's curious grief over his dying grandmother.
description: This award-winning animation film spares no feelings and minces no words. A poignant interpretation of a short story by Montreal author Mordecai Richler, it makes what is sometimes an embarrassingly frank statement about how many families respond to their old and infirm members. In soft simple washes of watercolour and ink, the filmmaker interprets reactions to a dying grandmother, capturing family feelings and distilling them into harsh reality.
